shortdesc.ph: Agora provides ensured quality of experience (QoE) for worldwide Internet-based voice and video communications through a virtual global network optimized for real-time web and mobile-to-mobile applications.

ul.li: As of v3.0.0, Agora deprecates the RtcEngineParameters class. class covers all APIs of this class, use the class instead.
During API calls, the SDK may returns error codes and warning codes. See Error Codes and Warning Codes.
provides the main methods that can be invoked by your application.
reports runtime events to the application.
AgoraRtcEngine.on listens to events during runtime.
provides methods that enable real-time communications in a specified channel. By creating multiple objects, the user can join multiple channels at the same time.
listens to events and statistics of a specified channel.
AgoraRtcChannel.on provides callbacks that report events and statistics of a specified channel.
allows for audio device interface testing.
allows for video device interface testing.
allows for audio and video device interface testing.

section.title: Statistics events
section.p: After joining a channel, SDK triggers this group of callbacks once every two seconds.
We provide an advanced guide for these callbacks. For details, see .

section.title: Multiple channels management
section.p: We provide an advanced guide on the applicable scenarios, implementation, and considerations for this group of methods. For details, see .

section.title: APIs for the second instance
section.p: Agora Electron SDK provides methods for a second instance. The second instance is used for screen sharing. Call the following methods to achieve corresponding functions for the second instance.
The following table lists the callbacks for the second instance.
